tensordb.storages.ZarrStorage¶

class tensordb.storages.ZarrStorage(chunks: Optional[Dict[str, int]] = None, synchronizer: Optional[Literal[process, thread]] = None, process_synchronizer_path: str = '', **kwargs)¶

Storage created for the Zarr files which implement the necessary methods to be used by the TensorClient.

Parameters
chunks: Dict[str, int], default None

Define the chunks of the Zarr files, read the doc of the Xarray method to_zarr in the parameter ‘chunks’ for more details.

synchronizer: {‘thread’, ‘process’}, default None

Depending on the option send it will create a zarr.sync.ThreadSynchronizer or a zarr.sync.ProcessSynchronizer for more info read the doc of Zarr synchronizer and the Xarray to_zarr method in the parameter ‘synchronizer’.

TODO:

  1. Add more examples to the documentation

__init__(chunks: Optional[Dict[str, int]] = None, synchronizer: Optional[Literal[process, thread]] = None, process_synchronizer_path: str = '', **kwargs)¶

Methods

__init__([chunks, synchronizer, …])

append(new_data[, compute])

Append data at the end of a Zarr file (in case that the file does not exist it will call the store method), internally it calls the to_zarr method for every dimension of your data.

delete_tensor()

Delete the tensor

exist()

Indicate if the tensor exist or not

get_data_names_list()

read()

Read a tensor stored, internally it use open_zarr method.

store(new_data[, compute])

Store the data, the dtype and all the details will depend of what you pass in the new_data parameter, internally this method calls the to_zarr method with a ‘w’ mode using that data.

update(new_data[, compute, complete_update_dims])

Replace data on an existing Zarr files based on the new_data, internally calls the to_zarr method using the region parameter, so it automatically create this region based on your new_data, in some cases it could even replace all the data in the file even if you only has two coords in your new_data this happend due that Xarray only allows to write in contigous blocks (region) (read carefully how the region parameter works in Xarray)

upsert(new_data[, compute, complete_update_dims])

Calls the update and then the append method

Attributes

base_map

ZarrStorage tensordb.storages.ZarrStorage.read
